title: Tyga boards a private yacht in Sydney Harbour and is joined by a bevy of bikini-clad beauties
text:
Advertisement

He left hundreds of concert-goers outraged after walking off stage just 15 minutes into his set in Wollongong on Sunday night.

But on Tuesday, Tyga didn't seem at all concerned about his ill-fated performance - as he was spotted boarding a luxury yacht to party with a bevy of bikini-clad beauties.

Kylie Jenner's 29-year-old ex - who charged up to $90 per ticket for the sold-out gig - appeared calm alongside his huge entourage during the outing in Sydney's Woolloomooloo.

Partying his worries away! Kylie Jenner's rapper ex-boyfriend Tyga (L) boarded a private yacht in Sydney Harbour on Tuesday and was joined by a bevy of bikini-clad beauties... after THAT ill-fated Wollongong gig

If you've got it! Tyga's female guests stripped down to nothing but bikinis as they joined the rapper for a wild yacht party on Tuesday - two days after he left fans fuming with his on-stage performance

The musician shielded his face from view underneath a black baseball cap and despite the heat, opted for a pair of purple cargo pants and an oversized black jumper.

At least 18 female companions were seen waiting to join the Rack City hitmaker for some fun on-deck, adorned in a series of skimpy ensembles to keep cool in the blazing Spring sunshine.

His yacht appearance may infuriate some fans, who were left fuming over his highly-anticipated event at Wollongong's Towradgi Beach Hotel - which was completely sold out.

Not a care in the world! Tyga (second right) appeared in high spirits as he stepped out in Sydney with his entourage

Girls just want to have fun! The female companions flashed the flesh in a series of tiny outfit choices, as they joined the musician for a day on the ocean

Riding the wave: Tyga didn't appear phased by the reaction to his performance, after many fans demanded a refund following the 15-minute set

Enjoying some down time: Tyga is currently touring New Zealand and Australia and will perform at Sydney's Hordern Pavillion on Thursday October 24

The event kicked off at 6pm, with the rapper expected to go onstage at 11.15pm.

Fans paid up to $90 each for the event that featured four hours of DJs before Tyga eventually started performing at 11.45pm - half-an-hour later than expected.

Fans were left outraged and many people felt ripped off when the set finished about midnight.

Bevy of beauties! Tyga wasn't short of female companionship on Tuesday as they turned out in full force to join him for a yacht party

The life of luxury! Tyga has yet to comment on the performance, and was instead joined by a string of genetically blessed pals on-board the super-yacht on Tuesday afternoon

Keeping it cool: Tyga shielded his face from view underneath a black baseball cap for the outing, wearing a pair of purple cargo pants and oversized black jumper despite the heat

Having fun, ladies? At least 18 stunners were seen waiting to join the Rack City hitmaker for some fun on-deck, adorned in very skimpy outfits to keep cool in the blazing Spring sunshine

Turning up the heat! Tyga's sizzling party featured dozens of guests who appeared to be enjoying their excursion on the water - unlike his masses of fans from Sunday evening

Emily-Jayne Jackson was furious after the lights turned on and the rapper began to say goodbye to people.

'He started to high-five people before walking off the stage,' the 20-year-old told Daily Mail Australia.

'The lights turned on when he was still performing and I was like what's going on?'

Ms Jackson said as soon as the clock hit midnight police officers walked in as the crowd chanted for him to perform another song.

'Police walked in and then Tyga was high-fiving people and the lights turned on and everyone was ushered out,' Ms Jackson said.

Fuming: Hundreds of people were left furious after paying up to $90 to see Kylie Jenner's ex-boyfriend and rapper Tyga perform live, only for him to play for 15 minutes. Pictured during the concert on Sunday

Devastated: Fans waited up to five hours to see Tyga in Wollongong, who performed for just 15 minutes

Some attendees have demanded refunds, claiming they did not get their money's worth.

'$80 to listen to DJs play the same damn songs for more than four hours and have him only play for like 15 minutes? I want a damn refund,' one woman said.

'The poster only said Tyga, it didn't mention a DJ playing for five hours before hand, otherwise no one would have showed up until 10pm,' another said.

'They made out like it was all going to be Tyga and to only get 15 mins of him, for that price, is f***ed.'

The sub-promoter for the event told Daily Mail Australia that they purchased the show through entertainment agency Lucky Urbn, who had the responsibility of handling the logistics of the show and getting Tyga to the venue.

Unfair: Other fans have taken to social media demanding refunds from Kylie Jenner's ex-boyfriend (pictured together), with many claiming they did not get their moneys worth

'I'd like to apologise to everyone who came to the show and say that it's out of our control,' he said.

'I understand people may have felt unhappy or underwhelmed, we did everything to provide a memorable experience and his team let everyone down.'

'Last night's show is not a representation of how I run by business, and I am appalled this has happened to his hardworking fans.'

Tyga is currently touring New Zealand and Australia, jetting back to New Zealand for a performance at Hip Hop in the Park in Tauranga, New Zealand.

He will then jet back to Australia for a performance at Sydney's Hordern Pavillion on Thursday October 24 and a show on Friday at Melbourne's Margaret Court Arena.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Tyga's representatives for comment.
description: He left hundreds of concert-goers outraged after walking off-stage just 15 minutes into his set in Wollongong on Sunday night.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
